problem_names:
lemma infinite_contains_2_elems:
  assumes "infinite A"
  shows "\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A"

lemma infinite_contains_3_elems:
  assumes "infinite A"
  shows "\<exists> x y z. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<noteq> z \<and> y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A"

lemma card_geq_2_iff_contains_2_elems:
  shows "card A \<ge> 2 \<longleftrightarrow> finite A \<and> (\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A)"

lemma card_geq_3_iff_contains_3_elems:
  shows "card A \<ge> 3 \<longleftrightarrow> finite A \<and> (\<exists> x y z. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<noteq> z \<and> y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A)"
lemma card_eq_2_iff_doubleton: "card A = 2 \<longleftrightarrow> (\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})"

lemma card_eq_2_doubleton:
  assumes "card A = 2" and "x \<noteq> y" and "x \<in> A" and "y \<in> A"
  shows "A = {x, y}"

lemma bij_image_singleton:
  shows "\<lbrakk>f ` A = {b}; f a = b; bij f\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> A = {a}"
translations:

  assumes "infinite A"
  shows "\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A
proof(rule ccontr)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):

       x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<Longrightarrow>
    False
assume *: " \<nexists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A"

proof (state)
this:
  \<nexists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A

       x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<Longrightarrow>
    False

goal (1 subgoal):

using assms

using this:
  infinite A

goal (1 subgoal):

by (simp add: ex_in_conv infinite_imp_nonempty)

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>x. x \<in> A

  \<nexists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A

text \<open>Every infinite set has at least three different elements\<close>

lemma infinite_contains_3_elems:
  assumes "infinite A"
  shows "\<exists> x y z. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<noteq> z \<and> y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>x y z.
       x \<noteq> y \<and>
       x \<noteq> z \<and>
       y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A
proof(rule ccontr)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<nexists>x y z.
       x \<noteq> y \<and>
       x \<noteq> z \<and>
       y \<noteq> z \<and>
       x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A \<Longrightarrow>
    False
assume " \<nexists>x y z. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<noteq> z \<and> y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A"

proof (state)
this:
  \<nexists>x y z.
     x \<noteq> y \<and>
     x \<noteq> z \<and>
     y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<nexists>x y z.
       x \<noteq> y \<and>
       x \<noteq> z \<and>
       y \<noteq> z \<and>
       x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A \<Longrightarrow>
    False
hence "card A = 2"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<nexists>x y z.
     x \<noteq> y \<and>
     x \<noteq> z \<and>
     y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. card A = 2
by (smt DiffE assms finite_insert infinite_contains_2_elems insert_Diff insert_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  card A = 2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<nexists>x y z.
       x \<noteq> y \<and>
       x \<noteq> z \<and>
       y \<noteq> z \<and>
       x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A \<Longrightarrow>
    False
thus False

proof (prove)
using this:
  card A = 2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  card A = 2
  infinite A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  False

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
text \<open>Every set with cardinality greater than 1 has at least two different elements\<close>

lemma card_geq_2_iff_contains_2_elems:
  shows "card A \<ge> 2 \<longleftrightarrow> finite A \<and> (\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (2 \<le> card A) =
    (finite A \<and>
     (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A))
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. 2 \<le> card A \<Longrightarrow>
    finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A)
 2. finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y.
        x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A) \<Longrightarrow>
    2 \<le> card A
assume *: "finite A \<and> (\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A)"

this:

text \<open>Set cardinality is at least 3 if and only if it contains three different elements\<close>

lemma card_geq_3_iff_contains_3_elems:
  shows "card A \<ge> 3 \<longleftrightarrow> finite A \<and> (\<exists> x y z. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<noteq> z \<and> y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (3 \<le> card A) =
    (finite A \<and>
     (\<exists>x y z.
         x \<noteq> y \<and>
         x \<noteq> z \<and>
         y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A))
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. 3 \<le> card A \<Longrightarrow>
    finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y z.
        x \<noteq> y \<and>
        x \<noteq> z \<and>
        y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A)
 2. finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y z.
        x \<noteq> y \<and>
        x \<noteq> z \<and>
        y \<noteq> z \<and>
        x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A) \<Longrightarrow>
    3 \<le> card A
assume *: "card A \<ge> 3"

proof (state)
this:
  3 \<le> card A

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. 3 \<le> card A \<Longrightarrow>
    finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y z.
        x \<noteq> y \<and>

        y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A)
 2. finite A \<and>
    (\<exists>x y z.
        x \<noteq> y \<and>
        x \<noteq> z \<and>
        y \<noteq> z \<and>
        x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A) \<Longrightarrow>
    3 \<le> card A
hence "finite A"

proof (prove)
using this:
  3 \<le> card A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. finite A
using card.infinite

proof (prove)
using this:
  3 \<le> card A
  infinite ?A \<Longrightarrow> card ?A = 0

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. finite A
by force

proof (state)
this:
  finite A

goal (2 subgoals):

 2. finite A \<and>

        x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A) \<Longrightarrow>
    3 \<le> card A
thus "card A \<ge> 3"

proof (prove)
using this:
  finite A \<and>
  (\<exists>x y z.
      x \<noteq> y \<and>
      x \<noteq> z \<and>
      y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 3 \<le> card A
by (smt "*" Suc_eq_numeral Suc_le_mono card.remove card_geq_2_iff_contains_2_elems finite_insert insert_Diff insert_iff pred_numeral_simps(3))

proof (state)
this:
  3 \<le> card A

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
text \<open>Set cardinality of A is equal to 2 if and only if A={x, y} for two different elements x and y\<close>
lemma card_eq_2_iff_doubleton: "card A = 2 \<longleftrightarrow> (\<exists> x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (card A = 2) = (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})
using card_geq_2_iff_contains_2_elems[of A]

proof (prove)
using this:
  (2 \<le> card A) =
  (finite A \<and>
   (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (card A = 2) = (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})
using card_geq_3_iff_contains_3_elems[of A]

proof (prove)
using this:
  (2 \<le> card A) =
  (finite A \<and>
   (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A))
  (3 \<le> card A) =
  (finite A \<and>
   (\<exists>x y z.
       x \<noteq> y \<and>
       x \<noteq> z \<and>
       y \<noteq> z \<and> x \<in> A \<and> y \<in> A \<and> z \<in> A))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (card A = 2) = (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})
by auto (rule_tac x=x in exI, rule_tac x=y in exI, auto)

lemma card_eq_2_doubleton:
  assumes "card A = 2" and "x \<noteq> y" and "x \<in> A" and "y \<in> A"
  shows "A = {x, y}"
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  card A = 2
  x \<noteq> y
  x \<in> A
  y \<in> A

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. A = {x, y}
using card_eq_2_iff_doubleton[of A]

proof (prove)
using this:
  card A = 2
  x \<noteq> y
  x \<in> A
  y \<in> A
  (card A = 2) = (\<exists>x y. x \<noteq> y \<and> A = {x, y})

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. A = {x, y}
by auto
text \<open>Bijections map singleton to singleton sets\<close>

lemma bij_image_singleton:
  shows "\<lbrakk>f ` A = {b}; f a = b; bij f\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> A = {a}"
by (metis (mono_tags) bij_betw_imp_inj_on image_empty image_insert inj_vimage_image_eq)
end
